Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or reference to any legal ban on the existence or construction of mosques in Poland.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Poland has refused to allow mosques to be constructed until churches can be built in Saudi Arabia, which is not supported by any evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by the expert, stating that the opposition to mosque construction in Poland is due to concerns about Islam spreading eastwards in the staunchly Catholic country.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting a meme as if it were a factual statement, which is not the case.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that mosques do exist in Poland, which is confirmed by searches of legislation and news reports.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by presenting it as a legal ban on mosques in Poland, when in reality, it is opposition and concerns about Islam.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
